numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some families are richer than other families.
2. Some rich families have a legacy boost.
3. Applicants from rich families with a legacy boost are admitted more easily to high-prestige colleges.
4. Some families are poorer than other families.
5. Applicants from poor families must work harder to be admitted to high-prestige colleges.
6. The financial situation of a family affects the admission of an applicant.
7. This comment refers to a graph.
8. I wonder how the graph looks in the present time.
9. I wonder whether the situation has worsened.
10. I wonder whether the situation has improved.
11. Some high-prestige colleges look for applicants with a legacy.
12. I wonder why some high-prestige colleges look for applicants with a legacy.
13. Some applicants have the best scores.
14. Some applicants meet the best criteria.
15. I wonder why some high-prestige colleges do not prefer applicants with the best scores and the best criteria.
16. This situation relates to my community.
17. In my community, some people judge other people based on education.
18. In my community, some people judge other people based on the college that a person attended.
19. I am starting to look at colleges to attend.
20. Some elite colleges are biased toward high-income applicants.
21. Some elite colleges are biased toward legacy applicants.
22. I find this bias crazy.
23. The headline is: Attending College May Not be as Easy as it Seems.
